commands.speaker: Chika
commands.line: The moment we've all been waiting for... Dinner time!

commands.speaker: Nico
commands.line: I'm starving!

commands.speaker: Hanamaru
commands.line: Perfectly shimmering white rice, wild vegetable and mushroom tempura, sukiyaki, sashimi, and a steamed egg custard... It's everything I hoped for and more, zura. *Slurp*

commands.speaker: Kanata
commands.line: Hanamaru, you're drooling.

commands.speaker: Shizuku
commands.line: Everything looks magnificent. Even the way the food is arranged is beautiful.

commands.speaker: Nozomi
commands.line: *Giggle* You said it. Now let's eat before it gets cold. Down the hatch!

commands.speaker: Chika, Hanamaru, Nico, Kanata, Shizuku
commands.line: Thanks for the food!

commands.speaker: Shizuku
commands.line: *Munch* *Munch* Mmmm! The rice is so good! The more I chew, the more its gentle sweetness spreads in my mouth! This is bliss.

commands.speaker: Chika
commands.line: I read in the pamphlet that they use locally sourced rice here!

commands.speaker: Kanata
commands.line: The tempura is nice and crisp, too. I know they're professionals, but how the heck did they manage to make it this good?

commands.speaker: Nozomi
commands.line: I suppose that sort of question comes naturally to a master chef like you.

commands.speaker: Hanamaru
commands.line: Niiico! I've come to claim my meat, zura!

commands.speaker: Nico
commands.line: Urrrg... Fine! Just one slice, okay?!

commands.speaker: Kanata
commands.line: Huh? What's up with those two?

commands.speaker: Shizuku
commands.line: Apparently, they bet on a video game and the loser had to do something the winner asked them to.

commands.speaker: Nozomi
commands.line: So you lost, Nico-chi?

commands.speaker: Nico
commands.line: Shut it! Ugh, I shouldn't have said it'd be best out of five!

commands.speaker: Hanamaru
commands.line: Wooooooow! Massage chairs are amazing. Who knew paradise was right here in Japan, zura...

commands.speaker: Kanata
commands.line: Hanamaru, let me use it next.

commands.speaker: Chika
commands.line: Hey, guys! I'm gonna go take another bath with Nico.

commands.speaker: Nozomi
commands.line: You're going again?

commands.speaker: Chika
commands.line: Yup. I wanna know all about this famous hot spring inn!

commands.speaker: Nico
commands.line: Not to mention, my skin gets more beautiful with every dip! It's going to be so shiny and smooth, it'll be glowing under the stage lights! We'll see you later!

commands.speaker: Shizuku
commands.line: Chika and Nico still aren't back yet. It's been almost three hours since they left, too.

commands.speaker: Kanata
commands.line: Maybe they're looking through the gift shop? Or they could be in the rec room again.

commands.speaker: Hanamaru
commands.line: Even then, they've been out for way too long, zura. I'm gonna give them a call. I'll call Chika first.

commands.speaker: Hanamaru
commands.line: Huh?

commands.speaker: Shizuku
commands.line: She forgot to take her phone.

commands.speaker: Nozomi
commands.line: No use here, either. I just tried calling Nico-chi, but it isn't going through. She either has her phone off, or...

commands.speaker: Kanata
commands.line: Nozomi, why don't you use your tarot cards to figure out what they're doing right now?

commands.speaker: Nozomi
commands.line: Sure, I'll give it a try. Hyah!

commands.speaker: Hanamaru
commands.line: Which card is it, zura?

commands.speaker: Nozomi
commands.line: The Chariot in the reverse position... It symbolizes setbacks, uneasiness, and losing one's path.

commands.speaker: Shizuku
commands.line: Oh... Oh dear.
